'''Rhosgobel''' was the old home of the wizard [[Radagast]].<ref name=South>{{FR|South}}, p. 274</ref>

==Location==
Rhosgobel was located near the borders of [[Mirkwood]]<ref name=Council>{{FR|Council}}, p. 256</ref> near the southern end of Mirkwood,<ref name=Queer>{{H|Queer}}, p. 129</ref> probably on its western side south of the [[Gladden Fields]] and opposite of the [[East Bight]] of the forest,<ref>{{TI|MII}}, in the middle of map square L13, p. 305</ref> because scouts sent by [[Elrond]] used the pass at the sources of the [[Gladden River]], went down into [[Wilderland]] and over the Gladden Fields to reach Rhosgobel and returned over the high pass that was called the [[Redhorn Gate]] to [[Rivendell]].<ref name=South/>

==History==
At some point in time after his arrival in Middle-earth around {{TA|1000}}<ref>{{App|TA}}, second paragraph of the introduction, p. 1084</ref> the wizard Radagast made his home at Rhosgobel.

According to the wizard [[Gandalf]] Radagast lived at Rhosgobel<ref name=Queer/> in {{TA|2941}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2941, p. 1089</ref>

After the [[Council of Elrond]], some scouts from [[Rivendell]] crossed over the [[Misty Mountains]] using the pass at the sources of the Gladden River to come down into Wilderland and over the Gladden Fields to reach Rhosgobel, but they found that Radagast was not there.<ref name=South/>

==Etymology==
''Rhosgobel'' is a [[Sindarin]] name,<ref name=Fauskanger>{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/lh-rh.htm|articlename=On ''LH'' and ''RH''|dated=|website=Arda|accessed=9 April 2012}}</ref><ref name=Eldamo>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2006952073.html|articlename=S. ''Rhosgobel'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=25 October 2022}}</ref><ref name=RC>{{HM|RC}}, p. 241</ref> which means "russet village or 'town' (enclosure)".<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Rhogobel'', p. 241</ref> [[Helge Fauskanger]], [[Paul Strack]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] suggest that it is a compound of ''[[rhosc]]'' ("russet", "brown")<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}} entry '''RUSKÄ€''', p. 429</ref> and ''[[gobel]]'' ("walled house" or "village", "town").<ref name=Fauskanger/><ref name=Eldamo/><ref name=RC/><ref>{{LR|Etymologies}} entry p. '''PEL(ES)''', p. 424</ref> The name of the house was perhaps a reference to its resident, the Brown Wizard.

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In a very late note on the names of the Istari Rhosgobel was said to have been in the forest borders between the [[Carrock]] and the [[Old Forest Road]].<ref>{{UT|13a}}, Note 4</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
===Rhosgobel in adaptations===
<gallery mode="traditional" widths="200px" heights="150px">
File:The Hobbit - An Unexpected Journey - Rhosgobel.png|Rhosgobel in ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]''
File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Rhosgobel.jpg|Rhosgobel in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''
</gallery>

'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
: A layout, and a detailed description, is given of Rhosgobel. It is built around a large furry oak tree.<ref>{{ICE|4002}}</ref><ref>{{ICE|2019}}</ref>

'''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel is depicted as a u-shaped wooden house nestled in the woods surrounding a small blue pool of water or pond.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tradecardsonline.com/im/selectCard/card_id/186782/cards_lang/1|articlename=Rhosgobel|dated=|website=[http://www.tradecardsonline.com/ Trade Cards Online]|accessed=9 April 2012}}</ref>

'''2012: ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene, when it is attacked by [[spiders]]. Radagast later discovers that these spiders came from [[Dol Guldur]].

'''2014: ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene, when [[Radagast]] takes [[Gandalf]] from [[Dol Guldur]] to Rhosgobel after alerting the [[White Council]] to his presence there.

'''2019: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel, located in the [[Vales of Anduin]] region, is a large set of ruins located in the region of "Laerlad", once occupied by the [[Wood-elves]], but abandoned long ago. The cottage of [[Radagast]] is located inside the ruins, which, after briefly being overrun by the "Ungoladan" tribe in the aftermath of the [[War of the Ring]], was reclaimed by Radagast, who restored it as a refuge and sanctuary for the animals of Middle-earth.
